member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Common.FourBitNumber
member.summary: Type that is used to represent a four-bit number (0-15; or in binary format 0000-1111).
member.remarks: Four-bit numbers widely used by MIDI protocol as parameters of MIDI events (channel number, for example). Instead of manipulating built-in .NET numeric types (like byte or int) and checking for out-of-range errors all validation of numbers in the [0; 15] range happens on data type level via casting .NET integer values to the (see ).

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Common.FourBitNumber.TryParse(System.String,Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Common.FourBitNumber@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a four-bit number to its equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the equivalent of the four-bit number contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the is null or , or is not of the correct format. This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result will be overwritten.
member.returns: true if was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Type that is used to represent a seven-bit number (0-127; or in binary format 0000000-1111111).

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.Pattern
member.summary: Represents a musical pattern represented as a sequence of actions to create a musical composition.
member.remarks:
Pattern allows to represent musical composition as a set of actions like 'note' or 'program change'. In other words, it allows to create MIDI file in more musical manner.
There are two ways to get an instance of the :
Build a pattern from scratch with fluent API provided by .
Use one of extension methods within to create pattern by processing existing one.
You can see examples of building musical compositions in the corresponding article.

member.returns: The containing notes events generated by the current .

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternActionState
member.summary: Defines the state of a pattern action.
member.remarks: Pattern actions correspond to methods on . For example, creates 'Add note' action, so the state will define whether a note will be enabled, disabled or excluded from pattern at all.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternActionState.Enabled
member.summary: Action is enabled and will be exported to MIDI data.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternActionState.Disabled
member.summary: Action is disabled. It will still occupy time span corresponding to the action, but MIDI data will not be generated for it.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternActionState.Excluded
member.summary: Action is completely excluded from pattern. It won't occupy time span and MIDI data will not be generated.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified pattern.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternBuilder.Velocity
member.summary: Gets the velocity that will be applied to all further notes and chords if it's not specified explicitly. Velocity can be altered with .

remarks.para: There are methods to add notes and chords that don't take velocity as an argument. In these cases the value of the property will be used. For example, or .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternBuilder.NoteLength
member.summary: Gets the length that will be applied to all further notes and chords if it's not specified explicitly. The length can be altered with .

remarks.para: There are methods to add notes and chords that don't take length as an argument. In these cases the value of the property will be used. For example, or .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternBuilder.Step
member.summary: Gets the step size that will be applied to all further move operations if it's not specified explicitly. Step size can be altered with .

remarks.para: There are methods to move current builder's position that don't take step as an argument. In these cases the value of the property will be used. For example, or .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Composing.PatternBuilder.Octave
member.summary: Gets the octave further notes and chords will be relative to if it's not specified explicitly. Octave can be altered with .

remarks.para: There are methods to add notes and chords where octave is not specified explicitly. In these cases the value of the property will be used. For example, or .

remarks.para: There are methods to add notes by interval where root note is not specified explicitly. In these cases the value of the property will be used. For example, .

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiChunk
member.summary: Represents a chunk of Standard MIDI file.

remarks.para: MIDI files are made up of chunks. Each chunk has a 4-character type ID and a 32-bit length, which is the number of bytes in the chunk. You manage chunks via property of the .

There are two standard types of MIDI chunks: header chunk and track chunk. The first one will not be presented in the . Its data is used by the reading engine to set properties of the such as and . You cannot add header chunks in the chunks collection of the file since an appropriate one will be written by writing engine automatically on or .

The structure of a MIDI chunk allows any custom chunks be placed in a MIDI file along with the standard ones described above. You can implement custom chunks that can be read from and written to a MIDI file. See Custom chunks article to learn more. If you doesn't specify information about your custom chunk types the reading engine will read them as instances of the class where property will hold chunk's data and will hold the ID of a chunk.
See for detailed MIDI file specification.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MetaEvent
member.summary: Represents a MIDI file meta event.

remarks.para: Meta event specifies non-MIDI information useful to specific applications.

As with chunks, future meta events may be designed which may not be known to existing programs, so programs must properly ignore meta events which they do not recognize, and indeed, should expect to see them. Programs must never ignore the length of a meta-event which they do recognize, and they shouldn't be surprised if it's bigger than they expected. If so, they must ignore everything past what they know about. However, they must not add anything of their own to the end of a meta-event.
You can create custom meta events that can be read from and written to a MIDI file. See Custom meta events article to learn more.
See for detailed MIDI file specification.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiEvent.DeltaTime
member.summary: Gets or sets delta-time of the event.
member.remarks: Delta-time represents the amount of time before the following event. If the first event in a track occurs at the very beginning of a track, or if two events occur simultaneously, a delta-time of zero is used. Delta-time is in some fraction of a beat (or a second, for recording a track with SMPTE times), as specified by the file's time division.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesFormat
member.summary: Defines format of a MIDI data bytes. Depending on this format the specific MIDI data reading/writing rules can be applied.

remarks.para: If format specified, a system exclusive bytes layout is F0 <length> <bytes to be transmitted after F0>, and 0xFF status byte means a meta event.
If format specified, a system exclusive bytes layout is F0 <bytes to be transmitted after F0>, and 0xFF status byte means Reset system real-time event.

member.summary: Format used by MIDI files.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesFormat.Device

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.UnknownChannelEventPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on unknown channel event. The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if channel event has unknown status byte.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.UnknownChannelEventCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback used to read unknown channel event if set to .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.SilentNoteOnPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on Note On events with velocity of zero. The default is .

remarks.para: Although it is recommended to treat silent Note On event as Note Off you can turn this behavior off to get original event.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.InvalidChannelEventParameterValuePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on invalid value of a channel event's parameter value. The default is .

remarks.para: Valid values are 0-127 so, for example, 128 is the invalid one and will be processed according with this policy. If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if event's parameter value just read is invalid.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.InvalidMetaEventParameterValuePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on invalid value of a meta event's parameter value. The default is .

remarks.para: For example, 255 is the invalid value for the and will be processed according with this policy. If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if event's parameter value just read is invalid.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.InvalidSystemCommonEventParameterValuePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on invalid value of a system common event's parameter value. The default is .

remarks.para: For example, 255 is the invalid value for the and will be processed according with this policy. If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if event's parameter value just read is invalid.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.CustomMetaEventTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of custom meta events types.

remarks.para: Types within this collection must be derived from the class and have parameterless constructor. No exception will be thrown if some types don't meet these requirements.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.TextEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets an that will be used to read the text of a text-based meta events. The default is .

remarks.para: Value of this property will be used only if is not set.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.DecodeTextCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback used to decode a string from the specified bytes during reading a text-based meta event's text. The default is null.

remarks.para: If callback is not set, will be used.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.ZeroLengthDataPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on zero-length objects such as strings or arrays. The default is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.BytesToMidiEventConverter.NotEnoughBytesPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on lack of bytes in the underlying stream that are needed to read MIDI data (for example, DWORD requires 4 bytes available). The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if the reader's underlying stream doesn't have enough bytes to read MIDI data.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.EscapeSysExEvent
member.summary: Reprsents an "escape" system exclusive event which defines an escape sequence.
member.remarks: "Escape" system exclisive events start with 0xF7 byte and don't have a terminal 0xF7 byte that is required for normal sysex events. When an "escape" sysex event is encountered whilst reading a MIDI file, its interpretation (SysEx packet or escape sequence) is determined as follows: - When an event with 0xF0 status but lacking a terminal 0xF7 is encountered, then this is the first of a Casio-style multi-packet message, and a flag (boolean variable) should be set to indicate this. - If an event with 0xF7 status is encountered whilst this flag is set, then this is a continuation event (a system exclusive packet, one of many). If this event has a terminal 0xF7, then it is the last packet and flag should be cleared. - If an event with 0xF7 status is encountered whilst flag is clear, then this event is an escape sequence.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.EscapeSysExEvent.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified data.
member.param: Data of the "escape" sysex event.

member.summary: Clones event by creating a copy of it.
member.returns: Copy of the event.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.EscapeSysExEvent.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.NormalSysExEvent
member.summary: Represents a normal system exclusive event.
member.remarks: A MIDI event that carries the MIDI system exclusive message, also known as a "MIDI sysex message", carries information that is specific to the manufacturer of the MIDI device receiving the message. The action that this message prompts for can be anything. Note that although the terminal 0xF7 is redundant (strictly speaking, due to the use of a length parameter) it must be included. System exclisive events can be split into multiple packets. In this case the first packet uses the 0xF0 status (such event will be read as ), whereas the second and subsequent packets use the 0xF7 status (suzh events will be read as ). This use of the 0xF7 status is referred to as a continuation event.

member.returns: Copy of the event.

member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.
member.returns: A string that represents the current object.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiTokensReaderUtilities.EnumerateEvents(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiTokensReader)
member.summary: Returns all consecutive MIDI events read with the specified as a lazy collection.

remarks.para: A collection contained in the returned object will iterate over MIDI tokens with the until a file's end or start of a next chunk occurred.

For example, the reader is now at the first MIDI events of a track chunk that contains 10 events. The method will return an object that contains a lazy collection that will iterate over those 10 events only, because a next MIDI token in the file is not a MIDI event.

member.param: to read MIDI events with.
member.returns: An instance of the containing a lazy collection of consecutive MIDI events read with the .

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFile
member.summary: Represents a MIDI file.

Content of MIDI file available via property which contains instances of following chunk classes (derived from ):

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFile.TimeDivision
member.summary: Gets or sets the time division of a MIDI file.

remarks.para: Time division specifies the meaning of the delta-times of MIDI events within . There are two types of the time division: ticks per quarter note and SMPTE. The first type represented by class and the second one represented by class.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFile.Chunks
member.summary: Gets collection of chunks of a MIDI file.

remarks.para: MIDI files are made up of chunks. ollection returned by this property may contain chunks of the following types:
You cannot create instance of the . It will be created by the library on reading unknown chunk (neither track chunk nor custom one).

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFileFormat.SingleTrack
member.summary: The file contains a single multi-channel track.
member.remarks: File of this format has a header chunk followed by one track chunk. It is the most interchangeable representation of data.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFileFormat.MultiTrack
member.summary: The file contains one or more simultaneous tracks (or MIDI outputs) of a sequence.
member.remarks: File of this format has a header chunk followed by one or more track chunks. First track chunk is usually reserved for tempo information (it can contain events like , , ).

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFileFormat.MultiSequence
member.summary: The file contains one or more sequentially independent single-track patterns.

member.summary: Settings according to which should read MIDI data.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReaderSettings.NonSeekableStreamBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets internal buffer for reading MIDI data from non-seekable stream.

remarks.para: During reading MIDI data there are cases when reader should move current stream's position back. If stream doesn't support seeking, it will fail. So for non-seekable stream reading engine should maintain buffer of last N bytes to have ability to jump back. That N value is controlled by this property.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReaderSettings.NonSeekableStreamIncrementalBytesReadingThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets minimum count of bytes to read them from non-seekable stream incrementally instead of reading them all at once.

remarks.para: If count of bytes to read is greater than or equal to the value of this property, reading engine will read data by chunks of N bytes where N is a value of property. This property applies for non-seekable streams only. Since there is no way to determine available count of bytes within such streams, incremental reading can prevent .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReaderSettings.NonSeekableStreamIncrementalBytesReadingStep
member.summary: Gets or sets size of chunk for incremental reading of MIDI data from non-seekable stream.

remarks.para: This property works in conjunction with .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReaderSettings.BufferingPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets a rule according to which MIDI data should be buffered before reading. The default is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReaderSettings.BufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of a buffer that will be used by in case of policy used for .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReaderSettings.Buffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the buffer that will be used by in case of policy used for .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReaderSettings.BytesPacketMaxLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of a bytes packet that will be used by .

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings
member.summary: Settings according to which MIDI data should be read.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.UnexpectedTrackChunksCountPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on unexpected track chunks count. The default is .

remarks.para: This policy will be taken into account if actual track chunks count is less or greater than tracks number specified in the file's header chunk. If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if track chunks count is unexpected.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.ExtraTrackChunkPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on new track chunk if already read track chunks count is greater or equals the one declared in the file's header chunk. The default is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.UnknownChunkIdPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on chunk with unknown ID. The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if a chunk to be read has unknown ID.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.MissedEndOfTrackPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on missed End Of Track event. The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if track chunk doesn't end with End Of Track event. Although this event is not optional and therefore missing of it must be treated as error, you can try to read a track chunk relying only on the chunk's size declared in its header.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.SilentNoteOnPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on Note On events with velocity of zero. The default is .

remarks.para: Although it is recommended to treat silent Note On event as Note Off you can turn this behavior off to get original event stored in a MIDI file.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.InvalidChunkSizePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on difference between actual chunk's size and the one declared in its header. The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if actual chunk's size differs from the one declared in chunk's header.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.UnknownFileFormatPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on unknown file format stored in a header chunk. The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if file format stored in a header chunk doesn't belong to values defined by the enumeration.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.UnknownChannelEventPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on unknown channel event. The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if channel event has unknown status byte.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.UnknownChannelEventCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a callback used to read unknown channel event if set to .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.InvalidChannelEventParameterValuePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on invalid value of a channel event's parameter value. The default is .

remarks.para: Valid values are 0-127 so, for example, 128 is the invalid one and will be processed according with this policy. If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if event's parameter value just read is invalid.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.InvalidMetaEventParameterValuePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on invalid value of a meta event's parameter value. The default is .

remarks.para: For example, 255 is the invalid value for the and will be processed according with this policy. If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if event's parameter value just read is invalid.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.InvalidSystemCommonEventParameterValuePolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on invalid value of a system common event's parameter value. The default is .

remarks.para: For example, 255 is the invalid value for the and will be processed according with this policy. If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if event's parameter value just read is invalid.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.NotEnoughBytesPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on lack of bytes in the underlying stream that are needed to read MIDI data (for example, DWORD requires 4 bytes available). The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if the reader's underlying stream doesn't have enough bytes to read MIDI data.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.NoHeaderChunkPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets reaction of the reading engine on missing of the header chunk in the MIDI file. The default is .

remarks.para: If is used, an instance of the will be thrown if the MIDI file doesn't contain the header chunk.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.ReadingSettings.CustomChunkTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets collection of custom chunks types.

remarks.para: Types within this collection must be derived from the class and have parameterless constructor. No exception will be thrown if some types don't meet these requirements.

member.summary: Gets or sets collection of custom meta events types.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.TimeDivision
member.summary: MIDI file time division.
member.remarks: Time division specifies the meaning of the delta-times of events. There are two types of the time division: ticks per quarter note and SMPTE. Time division of the first type has bit 15 set to 0. In this case bits 14 thru 0 represent the number of ticks which make up a quarter-note. Division of the second type has bit 15 set to 1. In this case bits 14 thru 8 contain one of the four values: -24, -25, -29, or -30, corresponding to the four standard SMPTE and MIDI Time Code formats (-29 corresponds to 30 drop frame), and represents the number of frames per second. Bits 7 thru 0 (which represent a byte stored positive) is the resolution within a frame: typical values may be 4 (MIDI Time Code resolution), 8, 10, 80 (bit resolution), or 100.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.TimeDivision.ToInt16
member.summary: Converts this time division into 16-bit signed integer number that will be written to a file.
member.returns: 16-bit signed integer number representing this time division.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.TimeDivision.Clone
member.summary: Clones time division by creating a copy of it.
member.returns: Copy of the time division.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.ChordDetectionSettings.NotesMinCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a minimum count of notes a chord can contain. So if count of simultaneously sounding notes is less than this value, they won't make up a chord. The default value is 1. More info in the Getting objects: GetChords: Settings: NotesMinCount article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.ChordDetectionSettings.NotesTolerance
member.summary: Gets or sets maximum distance of notes from the start of the first note of a chord. Notes within this tolerance will be included in a chord. The default value is 0. More info in the Getting objects: GetChords: Settings: NotesTolerance article.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.ChordSearchContext.SingleEventsCollection
member.summary: A chord should be detected only within single events collection ( or ). It means all MIDI events that make up a chord should be present in one events collection.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.ChordSearchContext.AllEventsCollections
member.summary: A chord can be detected within all events collection ( or ) of the source ( for example). It means MIDI events that make up a chord can be present in different events collections.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.SteppedGrid.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.ITimeSpan})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified steps so all grid's times will be stepped according to those steps.
member.remarks: Grid's times will be distributed according to provided steps. So distance between first adjacent times will be equal to first step, distance between second adjacent times will be equal to second step and so on. When last step reached, steps will go from the first one.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified start time and steps so all grid's times will be stepped according to those steps.
member.remarks: Grid's times will be distributed according to provided steps. So distance between first adjacent times will be equal to first step, distance between second adjacent times will be equal to second step and so on. When last step reached steps will go from the first one.
member.param: Start time of the grid.
Collection of grid's steps.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.ILengthedObject.Split(System.Int64)
member.summary: Splits the current object by the specified time.

remarks.para: If is less than or equal to time of the object, the left part will be null. If is greater than or equal to end time of the object, the right part will be null.
Let's see a simple example. Suppose we have an object with time of 10 and length of 50. The table below shows what left and right parts will be in case of different values of :

item.term: Copy of the object with time of 10 and length of 20
Copy of the object with time of 30 and length of 30

remarks.para: To learn about other ways to split an object please read Objects splitting article.

member.param: Time to split the object at.
member.returns: An object containing left and right parts of the split object. Both parts have the same type as the original object.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Interaction.TimedEventData.EventsCollectionIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of events collection where is placed.
member.remarks:
Events collection means either or (which can be obtained via ). Note that index is from 0 to events collections count minus 1. Thus if, for example, a MIDI file has following chunks:
track chunk
custom chunk
track chunk
an event from the last chunk will have set to 1, because custom chunk is not treated as events collection and therefore doesn't take part in indexing.

member.summary: Gets the index of the within an events collection.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.InputDevice.WaitForCompleteSysExEvent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether system exclusive event is treated as received only when it's completed or not. Default value is true.

remarks.para: Some MIDI devices and MIDI subsystems of operating systems can split a system exclusive event into several parts on sending the event. If is set to true (default value), DryWetMIDI will wait until last part received, then the library will combine all event's parts into single MIDI event and fire the event.
For example, considereng following separate events are received (here bytes in hex format):
With set to true, the will be fired only once providing the single event:
(F7 is a marker of a completed system exclusive event).
With the property set to false you'll be notified with event two times, so every part will be considered as a MIDI event.

member.param: The property to get value of.

member.exception: is not in the list of the properties supported for the current operating system.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether playing is currently running or not.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.Loop

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.InterruptNotesOnStop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether currently playing notes must be stopped on playback stop or not.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.TrackNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether notes must be tracked or not. If false, notes will be treated as just Note On/Note Off events. The default value is false. More info in the Data tracking: Notes tracking article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.TrackProgram
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether program must be tracked or not. If true, any jump in time will force playback send corresponding to the program at new time, if needed. The default value is false. More info in the Data tracking: MIDI parameters values tracking article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.TrackPitchValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether pitch value must be tracked or not. If true, any jump in time will force playback send corresponding to the pitch value at new time, if needed. The default value is false. More info in the Data tracking: MIDI parameters values tracking article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.TrackControlValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether controller values must be tracked or not. If true, any jump in time will force playback send corresponding to the controller value at new time, if needed. The default value is false. More info in the Data tracking: MIDI parameters values tracking article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.Speed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed of events playing. 1 means normal speed. For example, to play events twice slower this property should be set to 0.5. Value of 2 will make playback twice faster.

example.para: Example below shows how you can use Speed property to set new BPM (if original data doesn't have tempo changes):

We want to have BPM of 240 here so we just divide it by original BPM value. If original BPM was 120, we'll get 2 which is exactly what we want - double the speed. If original value is 480, we'll get 0.5 which means speed will be slowed down by two times.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.Snapping
member.summary: Gets an object to manage playback's snap points.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.NoteCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets callback used to process note to be played.

example.para: In the following example every note to be played will be transposed by 10 half-steps up:
example.code:
var playback = midiFile.GetPlayback(outputDevice); playback.NoteCallback = (rawNoteData, rawTime, rawLength, playbackTime) => new NotePlaybackData( (SevenBitNumber)(rawNoteData.NoteNumber + 10), rawNoteData.Velocity, // leave velocity as is rawNoteData.OffVelocity, // leave off velocity as is rawNoteData.Channel); // leave channel as is
playback.Start();
example.para: Next example shows how you can filter out notes with velocity below 100:
example.code: playback.NoteCallback = (rawNoteData, rawTime, rawLength, playbackTime) => rawNoteData.Velocity < 100 ? null : rawNoteData;

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.EventCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets callback used to process MIDI event to be played.
member.remarks: Note that and won't be passed to . Since processing of a note requires syncing between pairs of corresponding events, such pairs are handled by to be sure that a note's integrity is not broken.

example.para: The following example filters out all Program Change events:
example.code: playback.EventCallback = (midiEvent, rawTime, playbackTime) => midiEvent.EventType == MidiEventType.ProgramChange ? null : midiEvent;
example.para: Next example shows how to replace program 1 in all Program Change events to program 2:

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.PlaybackStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time of the current playback. It defines start time of the region to play back.
member.remarks: In conjunction with you can define a region within the current playback which will be played. If you set the property to null the start of playback (zero) will be used.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.PlaybackEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the end time of the current playback. It defines end time of the region to play back.
member.remarks: In conjunction with you can define a region within the current playback which will be played. If you set the property to null the end of playback will be used.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.Stop
member.summary: Stops playing of the MIDI data. Note that this method doesn't reset playback position. If you call , playing will be resumed from the point where was called.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Multimedia.Playback.Play
member.summary: Starts playing of the MIDI data. This method will block execution of a program until all MIDI data is played.
member.remarks: If is set to true, this method will execute forever.

member.exception: is null or contains white-spaces only.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectTarget
member.summary: Target of an object that should be processed by a tool.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectTarget.Start
member.summary: Start time of a lengthed object.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectTarget.End
member.summary: End time of a lengthed object.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingAction
member.summary: Indicates whether an object is being processed should be skipped or not. The default value is .

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingAction.Apply
member.summary: Set new time to an object.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingAction.Skip
member.summary: Skip an object and leave its time untouched.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingInstruction
member.summary: Holds the new time that will be set to an object is being processed and action indicating whether quantizing should be cancelled or not.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingInstruction.Skip
member.summary: Indicates that object should be skipped and new time shouldn't be set.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingInstruction.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the with the specified time. This time will be set to an object is being processed.
member.param: The new time of an object.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingInstruction.Action
member.summary: Gets an action indicating whether processing should be cancelled or not.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimeProcessingInstruction.Time
member.summary: Gets the new time of an object.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvSettings
member.summary: Common CSV reading/writing settings.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvSettings.CsvDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets delimiter used to separate values in CSV representation. The default value is comma.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvSettings.IoBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of buffer used to read/write CSV data.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvConverter
member.summary: Provides methods to convert MIDI objects to CSV representation and vice versa.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvConverter.ConvertMidiFileToCsv(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFile,System.String,System.Boolean,Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings)
member.summary: Converts the specified to CSV represenattion and writes it to a file.
member.remarks: Note that can be converted to different CSV representations. You can specify desired CSV layout via using property.
member.param: to convert to CSV.
Path of the output CSV file.
If true and file specified by already exists it will be overwritten; if false and the file exists, exception will be thrown.
Settings according to which must be converted. Pass null to use default settings.
member.exception: is a zero-length string, contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters as defined by .

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
The specified path is invalid, (for example, it is on an unmapped drive).
An I/O error occurred while writing the file.

exception.para: One of the following errors occured:

item.description: This operation is not supported on the current platform.
The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvConverter.ConvertMidiFileToCsv(Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Core.MidiFile,System.IO.Stream,Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings)
member.summary: Converts the specified to CSV represenattion and writes it to a stream.
member.remarks: Note that can be converted to different CSV representations. You can specify desired CSV layout via using property.
member.param: to convert to CSV.
Stream to write CSV representation to.
Settings according to which must be converted. Pass null to use default settings.

exception.para: One of the following errors occured:

member.exception: An I/O error occurred while writing to the stream.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvConverter.ConvertCsvToMidiFile(System.String,Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings)
member.summary: Converts CSV representation of a MIDI file to reading CSV data from a file.
member.remarks: Note that CSV representation of a MIDI file can be different. You can specify expected CSV layout via using property.
member.param: Path of the file with CSV representation of a MIDI file.
Settings according to which CSV data must be converted. Pass null to use default settings.
member.returns: An instance of the representing a MIDI file written in CSV format.
member.exception: is a zero-length string, contains only white space, or contains one or more invalid characters as defined by .

The specified path, file name, or both exceed the system-defined maximum length. For example, on Windows-based platforms, paths must be less than 248 characters, and file names must be less than 260 characters.
The specified path is invalid, (for example, it is on an unmapped drive).
An I/O error occurred while reading the file.

exception.para: One of the following errors occured:

item.description: This operation is not supported on the current platform.
The caller does not have the required permission.

member.name: M:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.CsvConverter.ConvertCsvToMidiFile(System.IO.Stream,Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings)
member.summary: Converts CSV representation of a MIDI file to reading CSV data from a stream.
member.param: Stream to read MIDI file from.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.MidiFileCsvConversionSettings.CsvLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets layout of CSV representation of . The default value is .
member.remarks: At now there are two layouts: and which produces slightly different CSV representations. The default value is that gives more compact and more human readable CSV data.

member.summary: Gets or sets format of timestamps inside CSV representation. The default value is
member.remarks: Note that it is recommended to use if you use CSV layout to ensure produced CSV data can be read by other readers that supports format used by midicsv (http://www.fourmilab.ch/webtools/midicsv/) program.

member.summary: Settings according to which lengthed objects should be quantized.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings`1.LengthType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of an object's length that should be kept in case the opposite side is not fixed. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings`1.QuantizingTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the side of an object that should be quantized. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings`1.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets policy according to which a quantizer should act in case of an object is going to be moved beyond zero. The default value is .
member.remarks: When the start time of an object is not fixed, there is a chance that the object's end time will be quantized in a such way that the start time will be negative due to the object is moved to the left. Negative time is invalid so this policy provides options to prevent this situation.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings`1.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets policy according to which a quantizer should act in case of object's side is going to be moved beyond an opposite one that is fixed. The default value is .
member.remarks: When one end of an object is fixed, there is a chance that the object's opposite end will be quantized in a such way that the object will be reversed resulting to negative length. This policy provides options to prevent this situation.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.LengthedObjectsQuantizingSettings`1.FixOppositeEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an opposite side of an object should be fixed or not. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When an object's side is fixed the length can be changed during quantizing.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy
member.summary: Policy which defines how a quantizer should act in case of object's side is going to be moved beyond an opposite one that is fixed. The default value is .

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.CollapseAndFix
member.summary: Object will be collapsed and fixed at fixed end's time.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.CollapseAndMove
member.summary: Object will be collapsed and moved to the new time calculated by a quantizer.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.SwapEnds
member.summary: Ends of an object will be swapped.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.Skip
member.summary: Object will be skipped so quantizing will not be applied to it.

member.name: F:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy.Abort
member.summary: Throw an exception aborting quantizing.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of distance calculation used to find a time to snap an object to. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.QuantizingLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of quantizing from 0.0 (no quantizing) to 1.0 (full quantizng).
member.remarks: This setting specifies how close an object should be moved to nearest grid time. For example, 0.5 will lead to an object will be moved half the distance between its time and the nearest grid time.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate to filter objects that should be quantized. Use null if all objects should be processed.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.LengthType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of an object's length that should be kept in case the opposite side is not fixed. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the side of an object that should be quantized. The default value is .

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.QuantizingBeyondZeroPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets policy according to which a quantizer should act in case of an object is going to be moved beyond zero. The default value is .
member.remarks: When the start time of an object is not fixed, there is a chance that the object's end time will be quantized in a such way that the start time will be negative due to the object is moved to the left. Negative time is invalid so this policy provides options to prevent this situation.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.QuantizingBeyondFixedEndPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets policy according to which a quantizer should act in case of object's side is going to be moved beyond an opposite one that is fixed. The default value is .
member.remarks: When one end of an object is fixed, there is a chance that the object's opposite end will be quantized in a such way that the object will be reversed resulting to negative length. This policy provides options to prevent this situation.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.QuantizingSettings.FixOppositeEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an opposite side of an object should be fixed or not. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When an object's side is fixed the length can be changed during quantizing.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.TimedEventsQuantizingSettings
member.summary: Settings according to which timed events should be quantized.

member.summary: Settings according to which a should be split by vertical split methods.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.SplitNotes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether notes should be split in points of grid intersection or not. The default value is true. More info in the MIDI file splitting: SplitNotes article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.PreserveTimes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether original times of events should be saved or not. The default value is false. More info in the MIDI file splitting: PreserveTimes article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.PreserveTrackChunks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether track chunks in new files should correspond to those in the input file or not, so empty track chunks can be presented in new files. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.Markers
member.summary: Gets or sets that holds factory methods to create events to mark parts of split file.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileSettings.NoteDetectionSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets settings which define how notes should be detected and built. You can set it to null to use default settings.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitByObjectsSettings
member.summary: Defines how a MIDI file should be split by objects using method. More info in the MIDI file splitting: SplitByObjects article.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitByObjectsSettings.KeySelector
member.summary: Gets or sets a method to get the ID (key) of an object. The default value is null which means the default key selector will be used. You can use the property to implement custom key selection (please see ).

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitByObjectsSettings.WriteToAllFilesPredicate
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate to determine whether an object should be copied to each new file or not. The default value is null which means no one object will be copied to each file.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitByObjectsSettings.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate to filter objects out. The default value is null which means no filter applied.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitByObjectsSettings.AllFilesObjectsFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate to filter out objects that should be copied to each new file (i.e. for those objects returnes true for). The default value is null which means no filter applied.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByChannelSettings
member.summary: Defines how a MIDI file should be split by channel using method.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByChannelSettings.CopyNonChannelEventsToEachFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to copy all meta and system exclusive events to all the new files or throw them away. The default value is true>.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByChannelSettings.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate to filter events out before processing. If predicate returns true, an event will be processed; if false - it won't. If the property set to null (default value), all MIDI events will be processed.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByChunksSettings
member.summary: Defines how a MIDI file should be split by chunks using method.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByChunksSettings.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate to filter chunks out before processing. If predicate returns true, a chunk will be processed; if false - it won't. If the property set to null (default value), all MIDI chunks will be processed.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByChunksSettings.PreserveTempoMap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a tempo map shuold be preserved or not in new files. The default value is true.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByNotesSettings
member.summary: Defines how a MIDI file should be split by notes using method.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByNotesSettings.CopyNonNoteEventsToEachFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to copy all non-note events to all the new files or throw them away. The default value is true>.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByNotesSettings.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate to filter events out before processing. If predicate returns true, an event will be processed; if false - it won't. If the property set to null (default value), all MIDI events will be processed.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SplitFileByNotesSettings.IgnoreChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a note channel should be ignored or not. If set to true, notes with the same note number but different channels will be treated as same ones. The default value is false.

member.name: T:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileMarkers
member.summary: Provides factory methods to create events to mark parts of split file.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileMarkers.PartStartMarkerEventFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets a factory method to create event that will be placed at the start of a split MIDI file part.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileMarkers.PartEndMarkerEventFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets a factory method to create event that will be placed at the end of a split MIDI file part.

member.name: P:Melanchall.DryWetMidi.Tools.SliceMidiFileMarkers.EmptyPartMarkerEventFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets a factory method to create event that will be placed in a split MIDI file part if it's empty.

member.summary: Splits by channel. More info in the MIDI file splitting: SplitByChannel article.
member.remarks: All channel events () will be grouped by channel and then events for each channel will be placed to separate files. So each new file will contain channel events for single channel. If of set to true (default value), each new file will also contain all non-channel events from the original file. If an input file doesn't contain channel events, result file will be just a copy of the input one.

to split.
member.returns: Collection of where each file contains events for single channel and meta and sysex ones as defined by .
